src:
Tanah Ambles di Lokasi Tambang Kaltara Dipastikan Bukan Likuefaksi
04 Nov 2019, 22:21 by Haris Fadhil
Jakarta -
Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah (BPBD) Kalimantan Utara (Kaltara) sudah mengecek peristiwa tanah ambles di lahan usaha PT Pipit Mutiara Jaya, Kabupaten Tana Tidung. Pergerakan tanah dipastikan bukan likuefaksi.
"Berdasarkan hasil peninjauan tersebut ditambah hasil investigasi oleh tim dari Dinas ESDM Provinsi Kaltara, Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Provinsi Kaltara dan Dinas Lingkungan Hidup Kabupaten Tana Tidung disimpulkan bahwa fenomena itu bukan merupakan likuefaksi atau pencairan tanah," demikian keterangan BPBD Kaltara yang diteruskan Kepala Pusat Data Informasi dan Humas BNPB, Agus Wibowo dalam keterangan tertulis, Senin (4/11/2019).
Longsoran tanah ini terjadi pada Selasa (29/10). Akibat tanah longsor 6 unit alat berat tertimbun di antaranya 3 eksavator, 1 Dozer termasuk 1 articulated dump truck (ADT).
"Menurut data yang diterima, 3 ekskavator sudah berhasil dievakuasi," sambung keterangan BPBD.
Pengecekan ke lokasi longsoran tanah dilakukan sejumlah pihak pada Sabtu (2/11). Pihak dinas terkait diminta meningkatkan kewaspadaan dan pengawasan Kuasa Penguasaan (KP) di wilayah kerja masing-masing.

(fdn/fdn)
text:
The Ambles Land at the Kaltara Mine Site is Certainly Not a Likefaction
Nov 04 2019, 22:21 by Haris Fadhil
Jakarta -
The Regional Disaster Management Agency (BPBD) of North Kalimantan (Kaltara) has checked the sinking of land in PT Pipit Mutiara Jaya, Tana Tidung Regency. The ground movement is certainly not a liquid faction.
"Based on the results of the review plus the results of an investigation by a team from the East Kalimantan Provincial ESDM Office, the East Kalimantan Provincial Environment Office and the Tana Tidung Regency Environmental Office it was concluded that the phenomenon was not a liquidity or ground liquefaction," said a statement from the Central Kalimantan BPBD, continued by the Head of the Information Data Center and BNPB Public Relations, Agus Wibowo in a written statement, Monday (11/04/2019).
This landslide occurred on Tuesday (29/10). Due to landslides, 6 units of heavy equipment have been buried, including 3 excavators, 1 Dozer including 1 articulated dump truck (ADT).
"According to the data received, 3 excavators have been successfully evacuated," continued the BPBD statement.
Checking the landslide location was carried out by a number of parties on Saturday (2/11). Related agencies are asked to increase the vigilance and supervision of the Power of Attorney (KP) in their respective work areas.

(fdn / fdn)
